intro: Triodanis leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender leaf triodanis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Triodanis leptocarpa is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments and is a valuable component of native plant communities.
